briefdescription.para: ID from ParticleList if assigned.
Approx. remaining lifetime of particle.
Whether this particle repeats.
Whether this particle is queued for deletion.

description.para: Settings to make the Particle wiggle

briefdescription.para: Used for Wiggle API, to signal that wiggle API is currently doing work.
Used for Wiggle API, to restore after unparenting.
Used for Wiggle API, to restore after unparenting.
Used for Wiggle API, to restore after unparenting.

Used for Wiggle API, to restore after unparenting.

Used for Wiggle API, Interval for wiggling [0, m_MaxOriInterval[.

ctor
Purely here so that it can be emptied in ParticleSource.
Checks if particle is currently wiggling.
Makes the particle change direction by random_angle every random_interval seconds.

simplesect.para: This does not actually work on Particle with no parent, it should on ParticleSource
Calling SetWiggle(0,0) will effectively stop all wiggle functionality

parameterdescription.para: float Will be the range [-random_angle, random_angle[ to wiggle between
float Will be the time range [0, random_interval] to wiggle next time

briefdescription.para: Stops randomized wiggle.
Randomizes a new orientation and applies it.
Helper to get a randomized wiggle vector.
Helper to get a randomized wiggle float value.
Method to tell the particle to start playing.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList to start playing

briefdescription.para: Method to tell the particle to start playing.

simplesect.para: The parameter to set the ID will only work when the particle is not already playing

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList to start playing
int Flags to pass to the playing (None on this level)

simplesect.para: bool Whether the particle successfully started

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList to start playing

briefdescription.para: Method to tell the particle to stop playing.

simplesect.para: No flags available for Particle
Emitors are automatically removed later when its particle count is 0

parameterdescription.para: int Flags to pass to the stopping (None on this level)

simplesect.para: bool Whether the particle successfully stopped

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.14 and below.

description.para: Obtain information or set properties regarding the state of the Particle

briefdescription.para: Sets particle id.

simplesect.para: Does not work at runtime, particle object needs to be destroyed and then Particle needs to play again

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList to start playing

briefdescription.para: Gets particle id.

simplesect.para: This is not necessarily the CURRENT particle As one can use SetSource while the Particle is still playing But that will not change the particle before Particle is played again
int The last set Particle ID registered in ParticleList

briefdescription.para: Returns direct particle effect entity which is usually handled by this class 'Particle' if there is one.

simplesect.para: Is a child of this Particle
Object The Object with the particle component or null

briefdescription.para: Returns the parent of this Particle if there is one.

simplesect.para: Object The registered parent or null

briefdescription.para: Returns if there is any particle active.

simplesect.para: bool Whether there is any particle active

briefdescription.para: Returns the total count of active particles in all emitors.

simplesect.para: Internally does a sum, HasActiveParticle is better for a quick check
int Total count of active particles

briefdescription.para: Returns whether there is a repeating particle.

simplesect.para: bool whether there is a repeating particle

briefdescription.para: Returns the approx. max lifetime.

simplesect.para: float The largest lifetime sum among the emitors

briefdescription.para: Creates/Destroys ParticleEffect child according to current state.

simplesect.para: Is called from Play/Stop methods

briefdescription.para: Creates ParticleEffect child, called from UpdateState.
Destroys ParticleEffect child, called from UpdateState.

simplesect.para: Does not destroy it immediately As it simply nulls the lifetime Then it will be cleaned up by EOnFrame eventually

briefdescription.para: OnFrame update event decrementing the stored approx. lifetime and checking for deletion.
Creates ParticleEffect child, called from UpdateState.
Called before deletion from OnCheckAutoDelete.

memberdef.argsstring: (Object parent, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0", bool force_rotation_to_world=false)
memberdef.name: AddAsChild

briefdescription.para: Attaches this particle onto some object. If null value is provided then the particle will be detached from the current parent.

simplesect.para: Due to the members being filled in, AddChild/RemoveChild cannot be used with Particle when using Wiggle

parameterdescription.para: Object Parent onto which this particle will be attached
vector Attachment position local to the parent (optional)
vector Orientation local to the parent (Pitch, Yawn, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Force rotation to be in WS (Optional)

description.para: Helpful methods for getting or setting parameters

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a parameter of all emitors in the particle.

parameterdescription.para: int The parameter to apply the new value to (enum EmitorParam)
float The value to apply

briefdescription.para: Set the value of a parameter of an emitor in the particle.

parameterdescription.para: int The emitter to apply the new value to, -1 for all emitter
int The parameter to apply the new value to (enum EmitorParam)
float The value to apply

memberdef.argsstring: (int emitter, int parameter, out float value)
memberdef.name: GetParameter

briefdescription.para: Get the value of a parameter of an emitor in the particle.

parameterdescription.para: int The emitor to get the value from
int The parameter to get the value from (enum EmitorParam)
float The value

briefdescription.para: Get the value of a parameter of an emitor in the particle.

parameterdescription.para: int The emitor to get the value from
int The parameter to get the value from (enum EmitorParam)

simplesect.para: float The value

briefdescription.para: Scales the given parameter on all emitors relatively to their ORIGINAL value.

parameterdescription.para: int The parameter to adjust (enum EmitorParam)
float The multiplier to apply

briefdescription.para: Scales the given parameter on all emitors relatively to their CURRENT value.

parameterdescription.para: int The parameter to adjust (enum EmitorParam)
float The multiplier to apply

briefdescription.para: Increments the value of the given parameter relatively from the ORIGINAL value.

simplesect.para: It's a simple sum, so negative value decrements

parameterdescription.para: int The parameter to adjust (enum EmitorParam)
float The value to sum

briefdescription.para: Increments the value of the given parameter relatively from the CURRENT value.

simplesect.para: It's a simple sum, so negative value decrements

parameterdescription.para: int The parameter to adjust (enum EmitorParam)
float The value to sum

description.para: You can create a particle either at some position, or create it as a child on some object.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: CreateOnObject

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter and attaches it on the given object.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Object Instance on which this particle will be attached
vector Attachment position local to the parent (Optional)
vector Orientation local to the parent (Pitch, Yawn, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces particle's orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the object (Optional)

simplesect.para: Particle Created particle instance

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0")

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, vector global_pos, vector global_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter on the given position.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Vector Position where the particel will be created
vector Orientation (Pitch, Yawn, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces particle's orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the object (Optional)

simplesect.para: Particle Created particle instance

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.

description.para: You can use the following Play(...) functions to create and activate a particle in 1 line of your script.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: PlayOnObject

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter, attaches it on the given object and activates it.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Object Instance on which this particle will be attached
vector Attachment position local to the parent (Optional)
vector Orientation local to the parent (Pitch, Yaw, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces particle's orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the object (Optional)

simplesect.para: Particle Created particle instance

memberdef.name: Play

Creates a particle emitter on the given position and activates it.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Vector Position where the particel will be created

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.
Legacy way of using particles in the game.

simplesect.para: They work okay when just needing to play a particle once every once in a while But are extremely wasteful when it comes to playing multiple Particles at the same time
